data.title: Rafael Araujo - Men's Basketball 2002-2003
data.meta_description: Men's Basketball 2002-2003 - Rafael Araujo: The official athletics website for the BYU Cougars.
data.meta_site_name: BYU Athletics - Official Athletics Website - BYU Cougars
data.text:
Awards

BasketballTimes Second Team All-American (2004)

Associated Press All-American Honorable Mention (2004)

NABC All-District First Team (2004)

USBWA All-District (2004)

MWC Player of the Year (2004)

All-MWC First Team (2004)

All-MWC Third Team (2003)

MWC Player of the Week (4x)

Cable Car Classic MVP (2004)

BYU Highlights

Started in all 62 games, averaging 27.4 minutes per game

Averaged 15.1 point, 9.5 rebounds, 1.4 steals and 1.2 assists per game

Shot 56.7 percent from the floor, 26.8 percent from three and 69.1 percent from the free throw line

2nd highest field goal percentage (.567)

9th most steals per game (1.42)

8th most rebounds per game (9.5)

12th most double-doubles (24)

15th most offensive rebounds (178)

Personal

Born in August 1980

Native of Sao Paulo, Brazil

Parents are Tadeu and Neuza

Has one brother

Wife named Cheyenne and daughter named Tais

Enjoys playing soccer and big fan of Brazil's 2002 World Cup Champions

Dean's list student at Arizona Western

Despite coming to the United States without speaking English, he was able to complete his degree in four years

Graduated from BYU in April 2004 as a recreation management major

Before BYU

(BRAZILIAN NATIONAL TEAM):

Played against NBA and other professional players on the Brazilian National Team at the 2002 World Basketball Championships in Indianapolis

(ARIZONA WESTERN COLLEGE):

One of the top-10 junior college players in the country and considered among the top big men Earned second-team NJCAA All-America honors in 2001-02

As a sophomore led Arizona Western to a 28-3 record and No. 6 national ranking before losing in the finals of the NJCAA Region 1 Tournament

Scored 17.9 points and grabbed 10.7 rebounds for the Matadors while shooting 57 percent from the floor, 28 percent on threes (14-49 from three-point range) and 67 percent from the line

Was second-team all-region as a freshman in 2000-01 and a first-teamer and region MVP as a sophomore

Coached by Kelly Green

HIGH SCHOOL:

Attended Padre Anacleto High School
